content: Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath
Now it happened that Jesus was passing through  grainfields on a Sabbath, and His disciples were picking the heads of grain, rubbing them in their hands, and eating .
But some of the Pharisees said, “Why are you doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
And Jesus, answering them, said,
And He was saying to them,
On another Sabbath He entered the synagogue and taught; and a man was there whose right hand was withered.
Now the scribes and the Pharisees were watching Him closely  if He healed on the Sabbath, so that they might find  to accuse Him.
But He knew what they were thinking, and He said to the man with the withered hand,  And he got up and came forward.
And Jesus said to them,
And after looking around at them all, He said to him,  And he did ; and his hand was restored.
But they themselves were filled with senseless rage, and  discussing together what they might do to Jesus.
Choosing the Twelve
Now it was at this time that He went off to the mountain to pray, and He spent the whole night in prayer with God.
And when day came, He called His disciples to Him and chose twelve of them, whom He also named as apostles:
Simon, whom He also named Peter, and his brother Andrew; and James and John; and Philip and Bartholomew;
and Matthew and Thomas; James  of Alphaeus, and Simon who was called the Zealot;
Judas  of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.

And  Jesus came down with them and stood on a level place; and  a large crowd of His disciples, and a great multitude of the people from all Judea and Jerusalem, and the coastal region of Tyre and Sidon,
who had come to hear Him and to be healed of their diseases; and those who were troubled by unclean spirits were being cured.
And all the people were trying to touch Him, because power was coming from Him and healing  all.
The Beatitudes
And He raised His eyes toward His disciples and  saying,
Now He also spoke a parable to them:
The Parable of the Builders
